commit_message:
[WIP] Add new cluster config project_scope

Resolve network related items in Nova profiles limited to a project if
cluster has cluster.project_scope config set to True. By limiting
network items to a project, a profile is able to reference items that
have the same name across multiple projects (e.g. default security group
in diference projects).

Change-Id: I437f6d022690ab9c6e162aa3ca0e895af3cb13b7

WIP as pep8 no longer works on F32 for stable/train /o\

NOTE(lyarwood): Various changes were required to get this to work on
stable/train without backporting a considerable number of changes to the
func tests including the following:

- Adding TestVolAttachmentsDuringPreLiveMigration to super() as
  functional tests run against py27
- Adding USE_NEUTRON=True
- Adding api_major_version='v2.1'
- Adding self.api to self._wait_for_state_change calls
- Removing the use of _build_server and crafting the server creation
  request by hand
- Removing the use of _live_migrate and crafting the live migration
  request by hand

commit_message:
Add regression tests for bug #1889108

NOTE(lyarwood): Various changes were required to get this to work on
stable/train without backporting a considerable number of changes to the
func tests including the following:

- Adding TestVolAttachmentsDuringPreLiveMigration to super() as
  functional tests run against py27
- Adding USE_NEUTRON=True
- Adding api_major_version='v2.1'
- Adding self.api to self._wait_for_state_change calls
- Removing the use of _build_server and crafting the server creation
  request by hand
- Removing the use of _live_migrate and crafting the live migration
  request by hand

Related-Bug: #1889108
Change-Id: Ib9dbc792dc918e7ea45915e2c1dbd96be82ef562
(cherry picked from commit 4c970f499c31370495d84c91a10319d308d13fb9)
(cherry picked from commit 6db72002a65f30ac44b8df0a642b400ea272247e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-21 16:05:50.000000000', 'message': 'Keystone identity mapping to support project definition as a JSON

This pull request (PR) depends on https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1887515,
which is the proposal that enhances the identity mapping schema management.
Therefore, we first need to get that reviewed and merged.

Currently, the project assignment via the federated identity mapping is rather static.
This happens because of the find/replace mechanism that we have in place there.
Therefore, if the IdP provider generates an attribute that contains a JSON with project
definitions, we are not able to handle it in Keystone.

This PR introduces a new property in the federated identity mapping schema called
`projects_json`. In the schema, this property will accept a JSON string, that
defines all of the projects and their specific roles that the user must receive when
login-in to the OpenStack platform. Moreover, when using this extension,
roles (assigned to projects) are added and removed on the fly.

The extension is quite straight forward. We created a new ``federation_attribute_mapping_schema_version`` version (1.2).
This new version enables the handling of `project_json` in the attribute mapping.

Furthermore, we added code to handle the addition of extra roles for projects and
removal of roles that are present in OpenStack, but are not in the IdP data. This
is a mechanism to make the state of the OpenStack federated user consistent with
the Identity provider user attributes.

Change-Id: I585a0a15f739620d4f3a7a66e9d4cbc69469da8b
Implements: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1888412
Closes-Bug: #1888412

commit_message:
Keystone identity mapping to support project definition as a JSON

This pull request (PR) depends on https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1887515,
which is the proposal that enhances the identity mapping schema management.
Therefore, we first need to get that reviewed and merged.

Currently, the project assignment via the federated identity mapping is rather static.
This happens because of the find/replace mechanism that we have in place there.
Therefore, if the IdP provider generates an attribute that contains a JSON with project
definitions, we are not able to handle it in Keystone.

This PR introduces a new property in the federated identity mapping schema called
`projects_json`. In the schema, this property will accept a JSON string, that
defines all of the projects and their specific roles that the user must receive when
login-in to the OpenStack platform. Moreover, when using this extension,
roles (assigned to projects) are added and removed on the fly.

The extension is quite straight forward. We created a new ``federation_attribute_mapping_schema_version`` version (1.2).
This new version enables the handling of `project_json` in the attribute mapping.

Furthermore, we added code to handle the addition of extra roles for projects and
removal of roles that are present in OpenStack, but are not in the IdP data. This
is a mechanism to make the state of the OpenStack federated user consistent with
the Identity provider user attributes.

Change-Id: I585a0a15f739620d4f3a7a66e9d4cbc69469da8b
Implements: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1888412
Closes-Bug: #1888412
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739966/

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-27 12:55:37.000000000', 'message': "Add nested-virt-ubuntu-focal label

Ubuntu Focal has a newer libvirt version than Bionic (4.0.0 vs 6.0.0).
By adding a Focal-flavored nested-virt label, features made possible
by a more recent libvirt version can be tested in the gate.
Specifically, whitebox-tempest-plugin tests Nova's hw_video_type image
property. Support for the 'none' value was added in libvirt 4.6.0.

Change-Id: Id48fff64d13c258d9f22908debfad86c5f089bf5
"}, {'created': '2020-07-27 13:02:58.000000000', 'message': "Add nested-virt-ubuntu-focal label

Ubuntu Focal has a newer libvirt version than Bionic (4.0.0 vs 6.0.0).
By adding a Focal-flavored nested-virt label, features made possible
by a more recent libvirt version can be tested in the gate.
Specifically, whitebox-tempest-plugin tests Nova's hw_video_type image
property. Support for the 'none' value was added in libvirt 4.6.0.

Change-Id: Id48fff64d13c258d9f22908debfad86c5f089bf5
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742014/
"}]
commit_message:
Add nested-virt-ubuntu-focal label

Ubuntu Focal has a newer libvirt version than Bionic (4.0.0 vs 6.0.0).
By adding a Focal-flavored nested-virt label, features made possible
by a more recent libvirt version can be tested in the gate.
Specifically, whitebox-tempest-plugin tests Nova's hw_video_type image
property. Support for the 'none' value was added in libvirt 4.6.0.

Change-Id: Id48fff64d13c258d9f22908debfad86c5f089bf5
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742014/

commit_message:
Move some generic functions from IPA

This change exposes existing or copies from IPA functions that are
potentially common between ironic, IPA and ironic-lib itself:
1) utils.try_execute
2) disk_utils.udev_settle, partprobe and trigger_device_rescan
3) capabilities parsing and re-combining

Change-Id: I0ab42e082e8003415a1cac857d1c4b2044c5484d

commit_message:
[OVN] Use the Chassis_Private table for agents healthcheck

The core OVN team has introduced a new table called Chassis_Private to
avoid nb_cfg flooding when checking for the Chassis' status. The OVN
driver does rely on that mechanism for the agent liveness mechanism.

This patch makes use of this new table but it's also backward
compatible.

For more information, check the core OVN changes at:
https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254394.

Closes-Bug: #1892477
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from Neutron 1dddbbfc92b115bfd62e15081134a5cadbc15212)

Change-Id: I894a277c3e8e325068550f2ffcb7cdba0adf05eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 09:30:14.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] OVN driver to adapt to enable_distributed_floating_ip changes

Prior to this patch, if the [ovn]/enable_distributed_floating_ip
configuration option changed in an existing environment the OVN
driver wouldn't adapt to it requiring administrators to clear up the
"external_mac" column from the NAT table manually for the existing
floating ips.

With this patch, OVN will automatically correct existing NAT entries for
floating ips whenever this option changes.

To make the code simpler when handling the port up/down event this patch
always set the logical_port and the neutron:fip_external_mac key in the
external_ids column of the NAT entry when creating the floating ip.

Note that we are not using the maintenance task for this either, we are
re-using the event that set/unset the "external_mac" column for this
because, whenenver the service is restarted (after the configuration is
changed, we need to restart for it to take effect) the IDL will
re-trigger
those events.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I6a85fdde2558d781bf2853c5d11c5c964bbab81f)

commit_message:
[OVN] OVN driver to adapt to enable_distributed_floating_ip changes

Prior to this patch, if the [ovn]/enable_distributed_floating_ip
configuration option changed in an existing environment the OVN
driver wouldn't adapt to it requiring administrators to clear up the
"external_mac" column from the NAT table manually for the existing
floating ips.

With this patch, OVN will automatically correct existing NAT entries for
floating ips whenever this option changes.

To make the code simpler when handling the port up/down event this patch
always set the logical_port and the neutron:fip_external_mac key in the
external_ids column of the NAT entry when creating the floating ip.

Note that we are not using the maintenance task for this either, we are
re-using the event that set/unset the "external_mac" column for this
because, whenenver the service is restarted (after the configuration is
changed, we need to restart for it to take effect) the IDL will
re-trigger those events.

NOTE ABOUT THIS BACKPORT: Different from the master branch, this patch
also sets the "enable_distributed_floating_ip" in the
test_ovn_db_sync.py module. In the master branch, this was already set
prior to this patch.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I6a85fdde2558d781bf2853c5d11c5c964bbab81f)

Change-Id: Iebf658f44275fec948e34be439cf86092d2a782b
Closes-Bug: #1883559
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix pod not restarted when issue detected

Service pod which fails connection, timed out, or unexpected
error during health probing should return with error status.

Change-Id: I26795a9f421fbdc84e75501b729da043b898c994

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update

commit_message:
pcs commands on host: haproxy bundle

This implements the creation of the haproxy bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update
the deployment tasks are not run during the node update procedure but
only during the final converge. So we ran the role again there to make
sure that any config change will trigger a restart during the minor
update, so the disruption is only local to the single node being
updated. If we did not do this a final converge could potentially
trigger a global restart of HA bundles which would be quite disruptive.

NB: We had to remove a few tags that were present befaure because we want
to avoid that puppet checks for /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg existence
on the host.

Related-Bug: #1863442

Depends-On: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696

Change-Id: I20dc57a02a315ca361883b73e4fb1cb98cf438cb

commit_message:
Explicitely do not allocate initial space for virtual volumes

Initialize virtual volumes with no allocated initial space to prevent
consuming all space available during volume creation.
The behavior of virsh has changed, by default in the past the virtual
volumes were initialized automatically with no initial allocated space,
while with recent versions we need to specify explicitly to not
allocate initial space for the virtual volumes.

Change-Id: I588d0888c19304119af607433de6e35199f7c555

'}, {'created': '2020-08-25 18:10:55.000000000', 'message': 'pcs commands on host: rabbitmq

This implements the creation of the rabbitmq bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update
the deployment tasks are not run during the node update procedure but
only during the final converge. So we ran the role again there to make
sure that any config change will trigger a restart during the minor
update, so the disruption is only local to the single node being
updated. If we did not do this a final converge could potentially
trigger a global restart of HA bundles which would be quite disruptive.

NB: The init_bundle now has become the wait_bundle
as it just waits for rabbitmq to be up and functional

Related-Bug; #1863442

commit_message:
pcs commands on host: rabbitmq

This implements the creation of the rabbitmq bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update
the deployment tasks are not run during the node update procedure but
only during the final converge. So we ran the role again there to make
sure that any config change will trigger a restart during the minor
update, so the disruption is only local to the single node being
updated. If we did not do this a final converge could potentially
trigger a global restart of HA bundles which would be quite disruptive.

NB: The init_bundle now has become the wait_bundle
as it just waits for rabbitmq to be up and functional

Related-Bug; #1863442

Depends-On: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696

'}, {'created': '2020-08-25 17:08:39.000000000', 'message': 'pcs commands on host: mysql

This implements the creation of the haproxy bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

NB: in this case we keep the container init_bundle (renamed to
wait_bundle) around just use it to wait for galera to be up.

Depends-On: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696

Change-Id: Ie14819b66cecdb5a9cc6299b68a0cc70a7aa3370
Related-Bug: #1863442
'}, {'created': '2020-08-25 17:16:38.000000000', 'message': 'pcs commands on host: mysql

This implements the creation of the haproxy bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update
the deployment tasks are not run during the node update procedure but
only during the final converge. So we ran the role again there to make
sure that any config change will trigger a restart during the minor
update, so the disruption is only local to the single node being
updated. If we did not do this a final converge could potentially
trigger a global restart of HA bundles which would be quite disruptive.

NB: in this case we keep the container init_bundle (renamed to
wait_bundle) around just use it to wait for galera to be up.

Depends-On: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696

Change-Id: Ie14819b66cecdb5a9cc6299b68a0cc70a7aa3370
Related-Bug: #1863442

commit_message:
pcs commands on host: mysql

This implements the creation of the haproxy bundle on the host.
The testing protocol used is documented in the depends-on.

The reason for adding a post_update task is that during a minor update
the deployment tasks are not run during the node update procedure but
only during the final converge. So we ran the role again there to make
sure that any config change will trigger a restart during the minor
update, so the disruption is only local to the single node being
updated. If we did not do this a final converge could potentially
trigger a global restart of HA bundles which would be quite disruptive.

NB: in this case we keep the container init_bundle (renamed to
wait_bundle) around just use it to wait for galera to be up.

Depends-On: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696

Change-Id: Ie14819b66cecdb5a9cc6299b68a0cc70a7aa3370
Related-Bug: #1863442

commit_message:
Make WSGI server respect listen_* directives

The listen_port and listen_host directives are intended to allow
deployers of IPA to change the port and host IPA listens on. These
configs have not been obeyed since the migration to the oslo.service
wsgi server.

Story: 2008016
Task: 40668
Change-Id: I76235a6e6ffdf80a0f5476f577b055223cdf1585

commit_message:
Describe '[glance]/enable_rbd_download'

New option was introduced for faster download images directly from Ceph
instead of using the Glance API.

See the following blueprint for more details:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-image-download-via-rbd

Compared to the blueprint, this new option was added instead of reviving
deprecated '[glance]/allowed_direct_url_schemes'.

Change-Id: Ib7e52f386df2134aa043dc703b378d0737b1d36d

[{'created': '2020-08-19 17:39:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix horizon-nodejs jobs

Tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
The file package.json needs tox, install it to fix the job.

Install it via a pre-run playbook so that this is run in addition to all
of the playbooks of the parent.

Note for the reviewer in stable/stein we run nodejs-4 jobs as runtime.
I have cherry-pick this change from master which run nodejs-10 job
but simliar changes fixes the nodejs-4 jobs So I have added pre-run
playbook for nodejs-4 job as well.

Note in stable/rocky: We used nodejs4-jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs
which consumes npm jobs from zuul-jobs. We would like to install tox
in the 'pre-run' phase in each npm job, so this commit borrows the
npm job definitions in stable/stein including the cherry-picked commit.

Change-Id: Icf82fa96f7d90453f78cf564c847682a286ed575
(cherry picked from commit 7cd0debebe1a300a96f8d0f21626793be0a0bc41)
(cherry picked from commit 8da0dcd21200cc851e57de4dfa46c3c838c73c3c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix horizon-nodejs jobs

Tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
The file package.json needs tox, install it to fix the job.

Install it via a pre-run playbook so that this is run in addition to all
of the playbooks of the parent.

Note for the reviewer in stable/stein we run nodejs-4 jobs as runtime.
I have cherry-pick this change from master which run nodejs-10 job
but simliar changes fixes the nodejs-4 jobs So I have added pre-run
playbook for nodejs-4 job as well.

Note in stable/rocky: We used nodejs4-jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs
which consumes npm jobs from zuul-jobs. We would like to install tox
in the 'pre-run' phase in each npm job, so this commit borrows the
npm job definitions in stable/stein including the cherry-picked commit.

Change-Id: Icf82fa96f7d90453f78cf564c847682a286ed575
(cherry picked from commit 7cd0debebe1a300a96f8d0f21626793be0a0bc41)
(cherry picked from commit 8da0dcd21200cc851e57de4dfa46c3c838c73c3c)

commit_message:
RBD: remove rbd_keyring_conf option

This option was deprecated in the Ussuri release and is now removed.
See OSSN-0085 for details.

Change-Id: I3cc58b2d74d82ab6b2186e9ea7cfafeb4c3de822
Implements: bp rbd-remove-option-causing-ossn-0085

AddLSwitchPortCommand takes kwargs as columns and tag is one of them.
It is possible that tag is provided with the value None and that is
not valid. The proposed change gracefully handles such cases so the
transaction is not aborted.

Change-Id: I0f3cb6f534072e166610b417059acbe89302473a

(cherry picked from commit fe440bdd6be190588ec4310ef9630285c0acfec6)

commit_message:
[ovn]: gracefully handle logical switch ports with tag set to None

AddLSwitchPortCommand takes kwargs as columns and tag is one of them.
It is possible that tag is provided with the value None and that is
not valid. The proposed change gracefully handles such cases so the
transaction is not aborted.

Change-Id: I0f3cb6f534072e166610b417059acbe89302473a
Closes-Bug: #1888736
(cherry picked from commit fe440bdd6be190588ec4310ef9630285c0acfec6)

Maybe a video call with all interested reviewers at some point, if I'm not the only thicko who doesn't grok this..."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-06 19:07:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I can't find any existing typing stuff in Train - which, knowing
 > the Red Hat buzgilla that this is coming from, is how far we'd want
 > to backport this. I agree that it's useful, but I'm not sure it
 > belongs in a backportable bugfix.
 > 
 > More comments to come, this is just my initial reaction.

This is a duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741995/ which is why the type hints exist (I probably wouldn't have bothered were I starting from scratch). However, we've discussed this before and agreed that we shouldn't _not_ use something just because it's not backportable. master is the most important branch and minor modifications to e.g. add Python 2.7 support are acceptable.

Haven't looked at the other comments yet, mind, but I don't think this one is a blocker."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-08-06 19:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> > I can't find any existing typing stuff in Train - which, knowing

 > > belongs in a backportable bugfix.
 > >
 > > More comments to come, this is just my initial reaction.
 > 
 > This is a duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741995/ which
 > is why the type hints exist (I probably wouldn't have bothered were
 > I starting from scratch). However, we've discussed this before and
 > agreed that we shouldn't _not_ use something just because it's not
 > backportable. master is the most important branch and minor
 > modifications to e.g. add Python 2.7 support are acceptable.

We've discussed this on IRC - just editing out the typing stuff when backporting to a release that can't support them it fine.

I don't really like mixing typing with "real" fixes, but I can see how having them both in the same patch helps with understanding, so no objections from me on that front.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-06 19:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-08-06 19:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-08-06 22:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

> > I can't find any existing typing stuff in Train - which, knowing
 > > the Red Hat buzgilla that this is coming from, is how far we'd
 > want
 > > to backport this. I agree that it's useful, but I'm not sure it
 > > belongs in a backportable bugfix.
 > >
 > > More comments to come, this is just my initial reaction.
 > 
 > This is a duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741995/ which
 > is why the type hints exist (I probably wouldn't have bothered were
 > I starting from scratch). However, we've discussed this before and
 > agreed that we shouldn't _not_ use something just because it's not
 > backportable. master is the most important branch and minor
 > modifications to e.g. add Python 2.7 support are acceptable.
 > 
 > Haven't looked at the other comments yet, mind, but I don't think
 > this one is a blocker.

FWIW I don't agree that we should co-locate type annotation additions with bug fixes intended for backport. Master is the most important branch *but* I think the type additions are unrelated to the bug fix in probably all cases, unrelated to the review of the bug fix, and should be a separate change on top of the bug fix. The change would be "Add type annotations to <file>" or something like that.

Aside from the type annotations, I think the approach here makes sense. -1 for the change from pop() to get(), removal of the helper function, removal of the expected_task_state from the unit test (?), and inclusion of the type annotations in a fix, particularly one destined for backport.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-07 13:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

> (8 comments)
 > 
 > > > I can't find any existing typing stuff in Train - which,
 > knowing
 > > > the Red Hat buzgilla that this is coming from, is how far we'd
 > > want
 > > > to backport this. I agree that it's useful, but I'm not sure it
 > > > belongs in a backportable bugfix.
 > > >
 > > > More comments to come, this is just my initial reaction.
 > >
 > > This is a duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741995/
 > which
 > > is why the type hints exist (I probably wouldn't have bothered
 > were
 > > I starting from scratch). However, we've discussed this before
 > and
 > > agreed that we shouldn't _not_ use something just because it's
 > not
 > > backportable. master is the most important branch and minor
 > > modifications to e.g. add Python 2.7 support are acceptable.
 > >
 > > Haven't looked at the other comments yet, mind, but I don't think
 > > this one is a blocker.
 > 
 > FWIW I don't agree that we should co-locate type annotation
 > additions with bug fixes intended for backport. Master is the most
 > important branch *but* I think the type additions are unrelated to
 > the bug fix in probably all cases, unrelated to the review of the
 > bug fix, and should be a separate change on top of the bug fix. The
 > change would be "Add type annotations to <file>" or something like
 > that.

I really don't like having to write code without type hints just because it's being backported, and I was initially tempted to kick the type hints for existing function signatures to a separate patch but keep them for new functions (which should be written in the best approach in mind). That seemed silly when there was already a follow-up planned though, so I've moved them all out.

With that said, I'd really like the "put type hints in a separate patch" request to be a rare one, because such requests make the goal of getting to a fully typed codebase (which I think is a pretty desirable goal) an tougher bordering on impossible one. We say one shouldn't be making wildly unrelated changes in a patch, but there's a general antipathy towards refactor-only changes that don't contribute to an immediate bug fix or RFE. In a lot of the RFE stuff I've been doing lately, I've been using a strategy of "if you touch the function in a meaningful way, add hints" because they ultimately improve the code and help with review. I want to keep doing that because it seems far better for both me and the reviewer than type hint-only changes which I need to annoy people for reviews for [1].

 > Aside from the type annotations, I think the approach here makes
 > sense. -1 for the change from pop() to get(),

Done (no change needed)

 > removal of the helper
 > function,

Done (re-added)

 > removal of the expected_task_state from the unit test
 > (?),

Done (re-added)

 > and inclusion of the type annotations in a fix, particularly
 > one destined for backport.

See above.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova+branch:master+topic:mypy-integration'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-07 14:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-08-07 15:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-05 17:51:08.000000000', 'message': "Don't unset Instance.old_flavor, new_flavor until necessary

Since change Ia6d8a7909081b0b856bd7e290e234af7e42a2b38, the resource
tracker's 'drop_move_claim' method has been capable of freeing up
resources usage. However, this relies on accurate resource reporting.
It transpires that there's a race whereby the resource trackers
'update_available_resource' periodic task can end up not accounting for
usage from migrations that in the process of being completed. The root
cause is the resource tracker's reliance on the stashed flavor in a
given migration record [1]. Previously, this information was deleted by
the compute manager at the start of the confirm migration operation [2].
The compute manager would then call the virt driver [3], which could
take a variable amount of time to return, before finally dropping the
move claim. If the periodic task ran between the clearing of the stashed
flavor and the return of the virt driver, it would find a migration
record with no stashed flavor and would therefore ignore this record for
accounting purposes [4]. This results in an incorrect record for the
compute node, and an exception when the 'drop_move_claim' attempts to
free up the resources that aren't being tracked.

The solution is pretty simple. Instead of unsetting the old flavor
record from the migration at the start of the various move operations,
do it afterwards.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L1288
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/manager.py#L4310-L4315
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/manager.py#L4330-L4331
[4] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L1300

Change-Id: I4760b01b695c94fa371b72216d398388cf981d28
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879878
Related-Bug: #1834349
Related-Bug: #1818914

commit_message:
Don't unset Instance.old_flavor, new_flavor until necessary

Since change Ia6d8a7909081b0b856bd7e290e234af7e42a2b38, the resource
tracker's 'drop_move_claim' method has been capable of freeing up
resource usage. However, this relies on accurate resource reporting.
It transpires that there's a race whereby the resource tracker's
'update_available_resource' periodic task can end up not accounting for
usage from migrations that are in the process of being completed. The
root cause is the resource tracker's reliance on the stashed flavor in a
given migration record [1]. Previously, this information was deleted by
the compute manager at the start of the confirm migration operation [2].
The compute manager would then call the virt driver [3], which could
take a not insignificant amount of time to return, before finally
dropping the move claim. If the periodic task ran between the clearing
of the stashed flavor and the return of the virt driver, it would find a
migration record with no stashed flavor and would therefore ignore this
record for accounting purposes [4], resulting in an incorrect record for
the compute node, and an exception when the 'drop_move_claim' attempts
to free up the resources that aren't being tracked.

The solution to this issue is pretty simple. Instead of unsetting the
old flavor record from the migration at the start of the various move
operations, do it afterwards.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L1288

commit_message:
Make our import-workflow job also convert images to raw

This enables image conversion on the import-workflow job so that we at
least run those code paths somewhere in CI.

Change-Id: Ie4a9171f002b42a13c1786268057bdc0ab3804d0

commit_message:
[OVN] Use the OVN DevStack module

The DevStack module for OVN has now been moved to the DevStack repository,
this patch is deletes it from the Neutron repository.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748140/
Change-Id: I2c30b8130525380234d767a7cb46f9bcca2a0d6b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

subject: Clean up some of the OVN agent API methods
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-24 09:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-24 12:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-24 14:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-08-24 21:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I made some additional changes here after we chatted: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747794/. I wonder if for py2.7 if NuetronAgent.types could just be a hardcoded dict?'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-25 08:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I made some additional changes here after we chatted:
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747794/. I wonder if for py2.7 if
 > NuetronAgent.types could just be a hardcoded dict?

Thanks Terry, I will take a look at the changes but probably they would be backported on a separated patch right ?

re: NeutronAgent.types. It may be a bit tricky because I would need to move that dict to the constructor (__init__), otherwise, as a class attribute it will be evaluated at import time and the other two classes ControllerAgent and MetadataAgent are defined *after* the NeutronAgent one, so I would probably need to move things around it would be more complicated.

I actually tried to have the static dict as my first attempt to backport this to python2.7 but stumbled into this problem, then I changed to the implementation on this patch.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-25 08:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-25 12:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-08-25 13:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Was thinking could just do NeutronAgent.types = {...} after all of the definitions.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-25 13:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Was thinking could just do NeutronAgent.types = {...} after all of
 > the definitions.

Ah, that would work... I can try'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-08-25 15:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-08-25 15:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me! Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2020-08-31 08:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM (nice way to set NeutronAgent.types in that backport)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-09-02 19:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Clean up some of the OVN agent API methods

Adds ControllerAgent and MetadataAgent classes to organize some of
the OVN Agent API code.

Note from this backport: To be able to backport this to stable/train,
we had to remove the Python 3 only features used in the original patch
and make it compatible with python 2.7.

Change-Id: I9224edab2d27184ed96be1cdea2bd865aadff065
(cherry picked from Neutron 6723f4a485e2c60e45f45732c0881c126de06608)

Drop the dependency on oslo.service loopingcall

It forces eventlet on us and can be easily replaced with tenacity.

[{'created': '2020-09-01 14:30:29.000000000', 'message': 'move cleanup of pyc files

Previously pyc files  where only cleaned if clean.sh was run.
with this change a new clean_pyc_files function was introduced
with the logic that was previously in clean.sh but it is now
invoked from unstack.sh

With the previous behavior you could not stack with horizon
enabled then unstack and stack again due to the presence of pyc
files that were owned by root.

By moving the clean to unstack in stead of clean.sh you can
now stack, unstack and stack again without hitting the pyc issue.
since unstack is invoked by clean the existing clean.sh behavior has
not changed in practice except for the fact the pyc files are
removed sooner in the process.

commit_message:
move cleanup of pyc files

Previously pyc files were only cleaned if clean.sh was run.
with this change a new clean_pyc_files function was introduced
with the logic that was previously in clean.sh but it is now
invoked from unstack.sh

With the previous behavior you could not stack with horizon
enabled then unstack and stack again due to the presence of pyc
files that were owned by root.

By moving the clean to unstack in stead of clean.sh you can
now stack, unstack and stack again without hitting the pyc issue.
since unstack is invoked by clean the existing clean.sh behavior has
not changed in practice except for the fact the pyc files are
removed sooner in the process.

This change also removes support for findutils < 4.2.3
Ubuntu 12.04 and CentOS 6 both have 4.4.2 since they were
released 8 years ago and are now EOL its fair to assume
that all modern distros have 4.2.3+
https://repology.org/project/findutils/versions

Change-Id: I13c9aad9be7e0930a0d875b7d382090caf0b8982

[{'created': '2020-06-23 09:33:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove elementtree deprecated methods

`Element.getiterator` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getiterator

Change-Id: Iaf5291698d866c9c86cda0f255799d8f10fff3dd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove elementtree deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

`Element.getiterator` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed
in python 3.9, these changes switch usages to Element.iter() [3]

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getiterator
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.iter

Change-Id: Iaf5291698d866c9c86cda0f255799d8f10fff3dd

commit_message:
Suffix the ISO names with '.iso'

Some hardwares like ProLiant can validate the ISO images only if they are
suffixed with '.iso'. It is also recommended to suffix a particular file with
proper filename extension.

Change-Id: Ib754472e97006d0146dd0df99492b035c55a5c47
Story: #2008077
Task: #40768

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.


Story: #2007865
Task: #40186

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal

Change-Id: Ibff0fb285694297f74d82ea8275cd6ca0b857cb2

commit_message:
Update exception message for nova service

The TimeoutException for waiters.wait_for_nova_service_state was not
passing the state variable to the exception message just the binary,
host and timeout. Added the missing state variable to the message.

Change-Id: I173d4101e112fae05249a14715303d84e7d802ea

Well, as the author of the agent token work, I could have
sworn we covered this case, but it seems not and agent commands
could fail.

What was occuring, when the token is optional, we were not backing
down on the agent client and failing even though we could detect
the failure and handle it accordingly.

commit_message:
Handle an older agent with agent_token

Well, as the author of the agent token work, I could have
sworn we covered this case, but it seems not and agent commands
could fail.

What was occuring, when the token is optional, we were not backing
down on the agent client and failing even though we could detect
the failure and handle it accordingly.

Change-Id: Ibd7e17fb00747485c8072289fff9b28d4da17c39
Story: 2008002
Task: 40649

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I62cda9bbb51433672473c3f36e6da60f9d8241a5

subject: Workaround tripleo_nova_cache issue in ansible 2.9.11
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-01 21:15:13.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround tripleo_nova_cache issue in ansible 2.9.11

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/99a37234b7393fd1d70e03c4687dad809c12a670
changes the core action plugin to assume task_vars has ansible_facts and
ansible_delegated_vars keys when interpreter discovery is triggered.

The tripleo_nova_cache action plugin passes custom task_vars dicts via
self._exec_module that do not contain these keys.

This looks like a regression in ansible.
Workaround it for now while I take the issue upstream.

Change-Id: I57dc24b8450f900ac1fb4e4c2f420f104618c609
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround tripleo_nova_cache issue in ansible 2.9.11

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/99a37234b7393fd1d70e03c4687dad809c12a670
changes the core action plugin to assume task_vars has ansible_facts and
ansible_delegated_vars keys when interpreter discovery is triggered.

The tripleo_nova_cache action plugin passes custom task_vars dicts via
self._exec_module that do not contain these keys.

This looks like a regression in ansible.
Workaround it for now while I take the issue upstream.

Change-Id: I57dc24b8450f900ac1fb4e4c2f420f104618c609

[{'created': '2020-09-01 22:38:20.000000000', 'message': "Stop relying on future mtime in tripleo_nova_image_cache

The tripleo_nova_image_cache role was relying on a future mtime to convince
nova image cleanup logic to skip a specific image that we want to pre-cache.
This works well on nodes that are not currently hosting an instance of the
image, however if there is an instance using it then nova will reset the mtime
every 40 minutes (by default).

As a result it's not possible to provide fine grained control of the caching.
We can just ensure the image exists on the host with an mtime of now.
It should remain cache for at least remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds
from nova.conf (default 86400).

Change-Id: If836759020bcaeb0d3af47f2af7f98ff2150b606

commit_message:
Stop relying on future mtime in tripleo_nova_image_cache

The tripleo_nova_image_cache role was relying on a future mtime to convince
nova image cleanup logic to skip a specific image that we want to pre-cache.
This works well on nodes that are not currently hosting an instance of the
image, however if there is an instance using it then nova will reset the mtime
every 40 minutes (by default).

As a result it's not possible to provide fine grained control of the caching.
We can just ensure the image exists on the host with an mtime of now.
It should remain cache for at least remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds
from nova.conf (default 86400).

Change-Id: If836759020bcaeb0d3af47f2af7f98ff2150b606

commit_message:
Fix instance integration tests

Fixes image and flavor selecting when creating instances.
Before this patch, selenium selected wrong column to compare
image names. This is reproduced when table consists of two or
more images, and the first image in table is not the one, that
we are looking for.


Change-Id: Iaedcdaaabb63c5f60d057fbd7927556a6038b89c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-22 00:42:24.000000000', 'message': "Chef 16 support

This adds support for testing both Chef/Cinc 15 and Chef/Cinc 16 which are still
supported upstream. For now this disables voting on 16 as we have some known
issues that need to be worked out first.

In addition, this updates to Chef Workstation 20.8.111 which includes Chef 16
for spec testing. For now, let's only worry about doing unit testing against
Chef 16 and worry about integration testing to catch any issues with Chef 15.

Also remove installation of the fog-openstack gem as it's now included in Chef
Workstation by default.

Change-Id: I191b14a295bf323ab37f5a97298f9f0594e8843c
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>
"}, {'created': '2020-08-22 00:48:18.000000000', 'message': "Chef 16 support

commit_message:
Chef 16 support

This adds support for testing both Chef/Cinc 15 and Chef/Cinc 16 which
are still supported upstream. For now this disables voting on 16 as we
have some known issues that need to be worked out first.

In addition, this updates to Chef Workstation 20.8.111 which includes
Chef 16 for spec testing. For now, let's only worry about doing unit
testing against Chef 16 and worry about integration testing to catch any
issues with Chef 15.

Also remove installation of the fog-openstack gem as it's now included
in Chef Workstation by default.

Change-Id: I191b14a295bf323ab37f5a97298f9f0594e8843c
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 23:23:31.000000000', 'message': "Enhancements to TaaS agent driver failure handling

As per current handling if there is any failure in the taas agent driver
there is no way to convey that to the plugin. Due to which end user gets
the impression that everything went well. This is confusing.

Now, as part of this enhancement, when the tap resources are created
iniitally they shall be created with status 'DOWN' by TaaS plugin. Once
the TaaS agent driver exectuion is finished, it will ask the plugin to
set the status to either 'ACTIVE' or 'ERROR' depending on whether the
driver was able to do its tasks successfully or not.

Change-Id: If8b1aba3b3955fd705f2a13a79c7225a03369da6
"}, {'created': '2019-09-13 17:38:31.000000000', 'message': "Enhancements to TaaS agent driver failure handling

As per current handling if there is any failure in the taas agent driver
there is no way to convey that to the plugin. Due to which end user gets
the impression that everything went well. This is confusing.

Now, as part of this enhancement, when the tap resources are :-

1. Created: iniitally they shall be created with status 'DOWN' by TaaS plugin. Once
the TaaS agent driver exectuion is finished, it will ask the plugin to
set the status to either 'ACTIVE' or 'ERROR' depending on whether the
driver was able to do its tasks successfully or not.

2. Deleted: as per curretn handling plugin used to first delete the
resources from DB and then inform the agent. Now the sequence would be
that plugin informs agent first. Agent shall ask the plugin to set the
resource status t either INACTIVE (indicates successful deletion,
whereby plugin shall clear the resources from the DB) or
PENDING_DELETE (failure in deleting the resources from driver, whereby
plugin would simply update the status for the resource in DB).

Change-Id: If8b1aba3b3955fd705f2a13a79c7225a03369da6

"}, {'created': '2019-11-07 21:01:58.000000000', 'message': "Enhancements to TaaS agent driver failure handling

there is no way to convey that to the plugin. Due to which end user gets
the impression that everything went well. This is confusing.

commit_message:
Enhancements to TaaS agent driver failure handling

As per current handling if there is any failure in the taas agent driver
there is no way to convey that to the plugin. Due to which end user gets
the impression that everything went well. This is confusing.

Now, as part of this enhancement, when the tap resources are :-

1. Created: iniitally they shall be created with status 'DOWN' by TaaS plugin. Once
the TaaS agent driver exectuion is finished, it will ask the plugin to
set the status to either 'ACTIVE' or 'ERROR' depending on whether the
driver was able to do its tasks successfully or not.

2. Deleted: as per curretn handling plugin used to first delete the
resources from DB and then inform the agent. Now the sequence would be
that plugin informs agent first. Agent shall ask the plugin to set the
resource status t either INACTIVE (indicates successful deletion,
whereby plugin shall clear the resources from the DB) or
PENDING_DELETE (failure in deleting the resources from driver, whereby
plugin would simply update the status for the resource in DB).

Change-Id: If8b1aba3b3955fd705f2a13a79c7225a03369da6

commit_message:
Adds provides method to define name of resources

In Chef Infra Client 16.2, resources have to be named using the provides
method. The resource_name method has not been changed in order to be
compatible with Chef Infra Client <16.2.

Also fix URI.encode and URI.decode deprecations.

Update etcd depends to ~> 6.0 to fix Chef 16 deprecation warnings.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/747503
Change-Id: I24be89a3214207bac2df9eb360124871e0d8242f
Closes-Bug: #1886985
Signed-off-by: Henrique Santos <hfigueiredosantos@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

@sean, apologize for the delay, I have been focusing on zStream/baremetal automation until this past week. I've been addressing all of my patch reviews and hope to get to this early next week.  For this test I need to handle tracking nova.conf configs in cases of a heterogeneous cpu layout between nodes and should have something up afterwards."}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-24 20:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-24 20:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-24 20:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The overall test logic is good, a few notes:

1. You can use the 'host' boot server request arg (new in 2.74) to force a server to land on a host.

2. If we assume that whitebox gains something like CONF.cpus_per_node and CONF.nodes_per_host, your test needs... 4 (?) CPUs on each host. 2 dedicated, 2 shared,. Each dedicated VM gets 1 CPU (to allow for live migration), each shaared VM can get 2.

Given all of the above, you can skip your entire test if CONF.cpus_per_node * CONF.nodes_per_host (iow, total CPUs) < 4

3. You can then set dedicated=0,1 and shared=2,3 on both hosts

4. With the host thing from 1, you can force VMs to land where you want them. You can pull hosts from get_all_hypervisors(), and have server_dedicated_host1, server_shared_host1, server_dedicated_host2, server_shared_host2

5. With all of the above, it becomes much easier to do the test.

PS: see inline for parse_cpu_spec :)"}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-24 20:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-25 00:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Quick thought based on our IRC discussion. Maybe instead of exposing two functions to the test classes from BaseWhiteboxComputeTest, we keep the same basic logic of get_all_hypervisors() but always return the hostname.  Then for the SSHClient() when the hostname is passed in do a check similar to get_hypervisor_ip() just without the server checks. If an IP is listed in the tempest.conf use it, otherwise use the hostname.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-26 18:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-26 19:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

I think you have a bunch of assertions left over from the time that cpu_(shared|dedicated)_set was different on both hosts. Suggestion inline for how to make that happen.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-26 21:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-06-26 14:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-08-24 19:15:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Some nits inline, but I mostly think we need to simplify this. If we just add a helper that gives us all the CPUs in the deployment as such:

  def get_all_cpus():
    topology_dict = CONF.whitebox_hardware.cpu_topology
    cpus = []
    [cpus.extend(c) for c in topology_dict.values()]
    return cpus

Then we'd need to:

1. Require a min of 4 CPUs total (1 per instance)
2. Not require multi-NUMA :)
3. Assume the CPUs are numbered sequentially
4. Hard-code values for cpu_dedicated_set and cpu_shared_set on each host
5. Keep the rest of the main test logic the same, but our assertions would become easier.

Sounds sensible?"}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-08-24 19:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(6 comments)

Agreed, I'll simplify the approach to allow for both upstream/downstream execution."}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-08-31 19:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-09-01 14:49:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-27 20:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Added instance collocation migration test

Added a new test method, test_colloc_migration, to
NUMALiveMigrationTest. The method is designed to test blueprint [1].
Test requires a deployment of two compute nodes with at least two NUMA
nodes of identical topology. Test configures cpu_dedicated_set to use
all pCPUs from the first NUMA node of each host. The pCPUs of the second
NUMA node are used for the cpu_shared_set. Two instances will be created
on the first compute node, one will require cpu pinning and the other
will simply float on the available shared pCPUs. Each instance should
‚Äòfill‚Äô their respective NUMA node. This procedure is then repeated on
the second host.

After validating all pinning schemes for each instance is correct, the
floating instance on the first host will be migrated to the second. The
dedicated instance on the target host will be deleted and the remaining
dedicated instance will be migrated to the target host. The test method
will validate all instance migrations were successful and the three
instances are collocated on the same host. Finally it validates the
underlying pin scheme of the instances to confirm they are still
accurate after migration

A helper method _get_shared_cpuset was added to NUMALiveMigrationTest as
well. It parses an instance‚Äôs xml for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in
the vcpu tag. It then converts and returns the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô value into a set
of pCPUs.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f
'}, {'created': '2020-01-28 22:24:53.000000000', 'message': 'Added instance collocation migration test

Added a new test method, test_colloc_migration, to
NUMALiveMigrationTest. The method is designed to test blueprint [1].
Downstream RedHat BZ can be referenced here [2].  Test requires a
deployment of two compute nodes with at least two NUMA nodes of
identical topology. Test configures cpu_dedicated_set to use all pCPUs
from the first NUMA node of each host. The pCPUs of the second NUMA node
are used for the cpu_shared_set. Two instances will be created on the
first compute node, one will require cpu pinning and the other will
simply float on the available shared pCPUs. Each instance should ‚Äòfill‚Äô
their respective NUMA node. This procedure is then repeated on the
second host.

After validating all pinning schemes for each instance is correct, the
floating instance on the first host will be migrated to the second. The
dedicated instance on the target host will be deleted and the remaining
dedicated instance will be migrated to the target host. The test method
will validate all instance migrations were successful and the three
instances are collocated on the same host. Finally it validates the
underlying pin scheme of the instances to confirm they are still
accurate after migration

A helper method _get_shared_cpuset was added to NUMALiveMigrationTest as
well. It parses an instance‚Äôs xml for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in
the vcpu tag. It then converts and returns the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô value into a set
of pCPUs.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1693372

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f
'}, {'created': '2020-02-03 21:56:18.000000000', 'message': 'Added instance collocation migration test

Added a new test method, test_colloc_migration, to
NUMALiveMigrationTest. The method is designed to test blueprint [1].
The downstream Red Hat BZ can be referenced here [2]. Test also touches
on Red Hat BZ [3]. Test requires a deployment of two compute nodes. Each
compute node‚Äôs nova.conf will update their cpu_dedicated_set and
cpu_shared_set parameters based on the provided vcpu sizes of
‚Äòdedicated_flavor_vcpus‚Äô and  ‚Äòshared_flavor_vcpus‚Äô respectively. For
the test to execute, each host must be capable of holding two dedicated
instances and still have available host CPUs to configure the
cpu_shared_set.

Test will first deploy four instances total, a pinned instance and a
shared instance for each host. After validating all servers are up and
their pin scheme is correct, all instances from the first host are live
migrated to the second. The pin schemes are then revalidated to confirm
pinned instances do not intersect with each nor do they intersect with
the host CPUs configured in cpu_shared_set.

A helper method, _get_shared_cpuset, was added to NUMALiveMigrationTest.
It parses an instance‚Äôs XML for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the
‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag. It then converts and returns the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô value as a set of
host CPUs.  Another method, _get_cpu_configs, was repurposed and added
to BasePinningTest from [4]. It calculates the minimum number of host
CPUs needed to fit a required cpu_dedicated_set and cpu_shared_set. It
determines the host CPUs needed for each parameter and generates the
appropriate string configuration to add to nova.conf.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1693372
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1222414
[4] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/gitweb?p=openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin.git;a=blob_plain;f=whitebox_tempest_plugin/api/compute/test_cpu_pinning.py;hb=refs/changes/70/18070/52
Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f
'}, {'created': '2020-03-24 20:20:25.000000000', 'message': "Added instance collocation migration test

Added a two stage test meant to test both Nova feature [1] as well as
Nova bug 1289064. The first stage tests basic colocation of instances
using shared and dedicated cpu policies. With a two compute host
deployment, create two instances on each host. On each host, one
instance should use standard cpu policy and the other should use a
dedicated cpu policy. Validate all instances come up correctly and the
respective cpu mappings do not intersect with other pools.

The second stage involves migrating all instances from the first host to
the second. When migration is finalized a single host should have four
instances total, two with a dedicated cpu policy and two using the
standard policy. Validate the dedicated instance's cpu‚Äôs do not
intersect with each other or the shared pool of the host.

The commit adds a new test method, test_colloc_migration, to
NUMALiveMigrationTest. The test will update the cpu_shared_set and
cpu_dedicated_set of each compute node‚Äôs nova.conf If the host is single
NUMA, half of its cores will be allocated to dedicated cpus and the
other half for shared. If the host has multiple NUMA nodes, then all
cores from NUMA 0 will be used for the shared cpu pool and all cores
from NUMA 1 will be used for the dedicated cpu pool. This logic is
handled by the test method
NUMALiveMigrationTest._get_dedicated_and_shared_sets().

A helper method, _get_shared_cpuset, was added to NUMALiveMigrationTest.
It parses an instance‚Äôs XML for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the
‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag. It then converts and returns the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô value as a set of
host CPUs.

In order to correctly map the expected cpu configuration with what is
running live on the host, the method VirshXMLClient.get_fqdn_of_host()
was added to clients.py. This uses the connection address provided by
whitebox.hypervisors in tempest.conf to gather the hypervisor hostname.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f
"}, {'created': '2020-03-26 18:31:23.000000000', 'message': "Added instance collocation migration test

Added a two stage test meant to test both Nova feature [1] as well as Nova bug
1289064. The first stage tests basic colocation of instances using shared and
dedicated cpu policies. With a two compute host deployment, create two
instances on each host. On each host, one instance should use a standard cpu
policy and the other should use a dedicated cpu policy. Validate all instances
come up correctly and the respective cpu mappings do not intersect with other
pools.

The second stage involves migrating all instances from the first host to the
second. When migration is finalized a single host should have four instances
total, two with a dedicated cpu policy and two using the standard policy.
Validate the dedicated instance's cpu‚Äôs do not intersect with each other or the
shared pool of the host.

The commit adds a new test method, test_colloc_migration, to
NUMALiveMigrationTest. The test has a skip condition based on two new whitebox
config parameters: whitebox.cpus_per_numa_node and
whitebox.numa_nodes_per_compute_host. If the multiplication of these two amount
to four or more host CPU's the test will execute. Since the test assumes four
or more host cpus are available it will update each hosts cpu_dedicated_set to
use 0,1 and cpu_shared_set to use 2,3. To avoid guests being deployed cross
NUMA, flavor size for all guests is restricted to one vcpu, dictated by the
variable flavor_vcpu_size.

A helper method, _get_shared_cpuset, was added to NUMALiveMigrationTest. It
parses an instance‚Äôs XML for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the ‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag and
pass the result to parse_cpu_spec.

cpus_per_numa_node and numa_nodes_per_compute_host are both defaulted to one
in config.py and devstack/settings parameters WHITEBOX_CPUS_PER_NUMA_NODE and
WHITEBOX_NUMA_NODES_PER_COMPUTE_HOST were added for upstream configuration.
These values were set to four and two respectively.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f

"}, {'created': '2020-04-01 18:05:40.000000000', 'message': "Added instance collocation migration test

Added a two stage test meant to test both Nova feature [1] as well as
Nova bug 1289064. The first stage tests basic colocation of instances
using shared and dedicated cpu policies. With a two compute host
deployment, create two instances on each host. On each host, one
instance should use a standard cpu policy and the other should use a
dedicated cpu policy. Validate all instances come up correctly and the
respective cpu mappings do not intersect with other pools.

The second stage involves migrating all instances from the first host to
the second. When migration is finalized a single host should have four
instances total, two with a dedicated cpu policy and two using the
standard policy.  Validate the dedicated instance's cpu‚Äôs do not
intersect with each other or the shared pool of the host.

The commit adds a new test method, test_colloc_migration, to
NUMALiveMigrationTest. The test has a skip condition based on two new
whitebox config parameters: whitebox.cpus_per_numa_node and
whitebox.numa_nodes_per_compute_host. If the multiplication of these two
amount to four or more host CPU's the test will execute. Since the test
assumes four or more host cpus are available it will update each host
and leverage host CPUs 0-3. The first host will use 0,1 for its
cpu_dedicated_set and 2,3 for its cpu_shared_set and the second will use
the inverse configuration (dedicated: 2,3 and shared: 0,1). To avoid
guests being deployed cross NUMA, flavor size for all guests is
restricted to one vcpu, dictated by the variable flavor_vcpu_size.

A helper method, _get_shared_cpuset, was added to NUMALiveMigrationTest.
It parses an instance‚Äôs XML for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the
‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag and pass the result to parse_cpu_spec.

cpus_per_numa_node and numa_nodes_per_compute_host are both defaulted to
one in config.py and devstack/settings parameters
WHITEBOX_CPUS_PER_NUMA_NODE and WHITEBOX_NUMA_NODES_PER_COMPUTE_HOST
were added for upstream configuration. These values were set to four
and two respectively.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716344/

"}, {'created': '2020-04-03 19:44:58.000000000', 'message': "Added instance collocation migration test

Added a two stage test meant to test both Nova feature [1] as well as
Nova bug 1289064. The first stage tests basic colocation of instances
using shared and dedicated cpu policies. With a two compute host
deployment, create two instances on each host. On each host, one
instance should use a standard cpu policy and the other should use a
dedicated cpu policy. Validate all instances come up correctly and the
respective cpu mappings do not intersect with other pools.

The second stage involves migrating all instances from the first host to
the second. When migration is finalized a single host should have four
instances total, two with a dedicated cpu policy and two using the
standard policy.  Validate the dedicated instance's cpu‚Äôs do not
intersect with each other or the shared pool of the host.

In order to schedule the instances to their respective hosts necessary
to execute the procedure, the test takes advantage of the host parameter
added in 2.74 [2]. Since a large portion of the test method leverages
functions from NUMALiveMigrationTest, but the minimum microversion for
the class is 2.25, the class was refactored. There is now a base class
NUMALiveMigrationBase which holds all of the common helper methods and
NUMALiveMigrationTest is a chile of that base. A second child class has
been created, NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest, which contains the new
test method, test_collocation_migration, and sets the minimum
microversion to 2.74.

The test method  has a skip condition based on two new whitebox config
parameters: whitebox.cpus_per_numa_node and
whitebox.numa_nodes_per_compute_host. If the multiplication of these two
amount to four or more host CPU's the test will execute. Since the test
assumes four or more host cpus are available it will update each host
and leverage host CPUs 0-3. The first host will use 0,1 for its
cpu_dedicated_set and 2,3 for its cpu_shared_set and the second will use
the inverse configuration (dedicated: 2,3 and shared: 0,1). To avoid
guests being deployed cross NUMA, flavor size for all guests is
restricted to one vcpu, dictated by the variable flavor_vcpu_size.

A helper method, _get_shared_cpuset, was added to NUMALiveMigrationBase.
It parses an instance‚Äôs XML for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the
‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag and pass the result to parse_cpu_spec.

cpus_per_numa_node and numa_nodes_per_compute_host are both defaulted to
one in config.py and devstack/settings parameters
WHITEBOX_CPUS_PER_NUMA_NODE and WHITEBOX_NUMA_NODES_PER_COMPUTE_HOST
were added for upstream configuration. These values were set to four and
two respectively.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id67

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717355/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716344/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716311/

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f
"}, {'created': '2020-06-24 20:01:19.000000000', 'message': "Added instance collocation migration test

Added a two stage test meant to test both Nova feature [1] as well as
Nova bug 1289064. The first stage tests basic colocation of instances
using shared and dedicated cpu policies. With a two compute host
deployment, create two instances on each host. On each host, one
instance should use a standard cpu policy and the other should use a
dedicated cpu policy. Validate all instances come up correctly and the
respective cpu mappings do not intersect with other pools.

The second stage involves migrating all instances from the first host to
the second. When migration is finalized a single host should have four
instances total, two with a dedicated cpu policy and two using the
shared policy.  Validate the dedicated instance's cpu‚Äôs do not
intersect with each other or the shared pool of the host.

In order to schedule the instances to their respective hosts necessary
to execute the procedure, the test takes advantage of the host parameter
added in 2.74 [2]. Since a large portion of the test method leverages
functions from NUMALiveMigrationTest, but the minimum microversion for
the class is 2.25, the class was refactored. There is now a base class
NUMALiveMigrationBase which holds all of the common helper methods and
NUMALiveMigrationTest is a child of that base. A second child class has
been created, NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest, which contains the new
test method, test_collocation_migration, and sets the minimum
microversion to 2.74.

The class NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest has a skip check to validate
whitebox-hardware/cpu_topology is set in tempest.conf. The new method
test_collocation_migration has two skip checks based around
cpu_topology, validating there are at least two NUMA nodes per host and
each node has at least two or more pCPUs.

The test method uses all pCPUs from NUMA node 0 as the dedicated cpu set
for the first host and the shared set for the second host. NUMA node 1
provides the pCPUs for the dedicated range on host two and the shared
set range for host one. To avoid guests being deployed cross NUMA,
flavor size for all guests are restricted to one vcpu, dictated by the
variable flavor_vcpu_size.

A helper method, _get_shared_cpuset, was added to NUMALiveMigrationBase.
It parses an instance‚Äôs XML for the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the
‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag and pass the result to parse_cpu_spec.

For devstack deployments cpu_topology is set via
WHITEBOX_HARDWARE_CPU_TOPOLOGY which defaults to '0: [0,1,2,3], 1:
[4,5,6,7]'.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id67

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731557/

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f

In order to schedule the instances to their respective hosts necessary
to execute the procedure, the test takes advantage of the host parameter
added in 2.74 [2]. Since a large portion of the test method leverages
functions from NUMALiveMigrationTest, but the minimum microversion for
the class is 2.25, the class was refactored. There is now a base class
NUMALiveMigrationBase which holds all of the common helper methods and
NUMALiveMigrationTest is a child of that base. A second child class has
been created, NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest, which contains the new
test method, test_collocation_migration, and sets the minimum
microversion to 2.74.

The class NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest has a skip check to validate
whitebox-hardware/cpu_topology is set in tempest.conf. The new method
test_collocation_migration has one skip check based around
cpu_topology, that validates each host has four or more pCPUs.

The test method uses the first two pCPUs from cpu_topology as the
dedicated pCPUs for the first host and the shared set for the second
host. pCPU id's three and four are for the dedicated range on host two
and the shared set range for host one. To avoid guests being deployed
cross NUMA, flavor size for all guests are restricted to one vcpu,
dictated by the variable flavor_vcpu_size.

Two helper methods, _get_shared_cpuset and get_all_cpus, were added to
NUMALiveMigrationBase.  _get_shared_cpuset parses an instance‚Äôs XML for
the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the ‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag and pass the result to
parse_cpu_spec. Method get_all_cpus aggregates all cpus to a single
list from cpu_topology in found in section whitebox-hardware of tempest.conf.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id67

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f

commit_message:
Added instance collocation migration test

Added a two stage test meant to test both Nova feature [1] as well as
live-migration. The first stage tests basic colocation of instances
using shared and dedicated cpu policies. With a two compute host
deployment, create two instances on each host. On each host, one
instance should use a standard cpu policy and the other should use a
dedicated cpu policy. Validate all instances come up correctly and the
respective cpu mappings do not intersect with other pools.

The second stage involves migrating all instances from the first host to
the second. When migration is finalized a single host should have four
instances total, two with a dedicated cpu policy and two using the
shared policy.  Validate the dedicated instance's cpu‚Äôs do not
intersect with each other or the shared pool of the host.

In order to schedule the instances to their respective hosts necessary
to execute the procedure, the test takes advantage of the host parameter
added in 2.74 [2]. Since a large portion of the test method leverages
functions from NUMALiveMigrationTest, but the minimum microversion for
the class is 2.25, the class was refactored. There is now a base class
NUMALiveMigrationBase which holds all of the common helper methods and
NUMALiveMigrationTest is a child of that base. A second child class has
been created, NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest, which contains the new
test method, test_collocation_migration, and sets the minimum
microversion to 2.74.

The class NUMACPUDedicatedLiveMigrationTest has a skip check to validate
whitebox-hardware/cpu_topology is set in tempest.conf. The new method
test_collocation_migration has one skip check based around
cpu_topology, that validates each host has four or more pCPUs.

The test method uses the first two pCPUs from cpu_topology as the
dedicated pCPUs for the first host and the shared set for the second
host. pCPU id's three and four are for the dedicated range on host two
and the shared set range for host one. To avoid guests being deployed
cross NUMA, flavor size for all guests are restricted to one vcpu,
dictated by the variable flavor_vcpu_size.

Two helper methods, _get_shared_cpuset and get_all_cpus, were added to
NUMALiveMigrationBase.  _get_shared_cpuset parses an instance‚Äôs XML for
the ‚Äòcpuset‚Äô attribute found in the ‚Äòvcpu‚Äô tag and pass the result to
parse_cpu_spec. Method get_all_cpus aggregates all cpus to a single
list from cpu_topology in found in section whitebox-hardware of tempest.conf.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id67

Change-Id: If9eab53861079a1ca1530f6dd56ee0f39216077f

subject: drop mock from lower-constraints
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-09 09:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-09 14:11:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I think it would be more useful to refresh all lower constraints, but this does at least clean things up.

The issue I've seen is that with a refresh of lower constraints, you'll find that mock is still being installed by one of the dependencies. Lower constraints is supposed to cover that, so technically a lot of these patches are incorrect. But I am being optimistic that we will soon have all the mock dependencies removed for all direct dependencies."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-09-02 14:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-09 09:54:56.000000000', 'message': "drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I668a2f65431e8870268e067e1c0acd4d94a65c95
"}]
commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I668a2f65431e8870268e067e1c0acd4d94a65c95

commit_message:
Remove F403, F812 and F821 from the ignorelist in tox.ini

They are not needed since no such errors are triggered when running
flake8.

Change-Id: If6ba0627ca680167378543b4c38135aa2bd6a730

"}, {'created': '2020-08-24 19:18:49.000000000', 'message': "Don't unset Instance.old_flavor, new_flavor until necessary

Since change Ia6d8a7909081b0b856bd7e290e234af7e42a2b38, the resource
tracker's 'drop_move_claim' method has been capable of freeing up
resource usage. However, this relies on accurate resource reporting.
It transpires that there's a race whereby the resource tracker's
'update_available_resource' periodic task can end up not accounting for
usage from migrations that are in the process of being completed. The
root cause is the resource tracker's reliance on the stashed flavor in a
given migration record [1]. Previously, this information was deleted by
the compute manager at the start of the confirm migration operation [2].
The compute manager would then call the virt driver [3], which could
take a not insignificant amount of time to return, before finally
dropping the move claim. If the periodic task ran between the clearing
of the stashed flavor and the return of the virt driver, it would find a
migration record with no stashed flavor and would therefore ignore this
record for accounting purposes [4], resulting in an incorrect record for
the compute node, and an exception when the 'drop_move_claim' attempts
to free up the resources that aren't being tracked.

The solution to this issue is pretty simple. Instead of unsetting the
old flavor record from the migration at the start of the various move
operations, do it afterwards.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L1288
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/manager.py#L4310-L4315
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/manager.py#L4330-L4331
[4] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6557d67/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L1300

Change-Id: I9317404f790004511db8edc08a414a706d42265f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1879878
Related-Bug: #1834349
Related-Bug: #1818914
